name: Chunky Monkey Cupcakes
author: Chef John
summary: Banana, walnut, and chocolate are always an amazing combination of ingredients, no matter what the delivery system, but it really doesn't get any better than in this ganache-frosted cupcake. A close second would be a chocolate-dipped frozen banana, rolled in walnuts, which is also a great treat, although much more awkward to eat in public. Feel free to omit the frosting and just enjoy these as muffins.
ingredients: 1 cup very hot, but not boiling cream
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and line a 12-cup muffin tin with liners
Whisk flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a bowl
Mash bananas with milk and vanilla extract until smooth
Mix butter and sugar together with a spatula until creamy
Whisk in eggs, 1 at a time, then whisk in the banana mixture
Add walnuts, chocolate, and the flour mixture
Mix batter with a spatula until no dry spots remain
Fill muffin cups to the top with batter, then distribute excess batter as needed
Tap pan against the counter to expel any air bubbles
Bake in the preheated oven until tops are lightly browned, about 25 minutes
Let cupcakes cool to room temperature, at least 20 minutes
Pour hot cream over chocolate chips in a bowl
Let sit for a few minutes, then whisk, increasing speed gradually, until color is uniform
Spread ganache over the cooled cupcakes and garnish with banana chips
Refrigerate to firm up the frosting, if desired
